name: Sheraton Heathrow Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very poor hotel that fails to live up to standards. Shabby and cramped, with bad air-conditioning and dark scary corridors.
reviews.title: Impersonal, dated and cramped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It seems to be entirely geared for low-brow business travellers and should be avoided if you can. Even the TV channel choices are hopeless!
reviews.title: Don't stay at this hotel

likes.liked: — I ordered room service and the food was good.

reviews.text: The typically British hotel scam of charging the earth for in-room web access is especially bad here. Two laptops, one night. Sixty dollars. Disgraceful - but part of a UK big hotel trend, sadly.
reviews.title: Good (for the budget conscious traveller) and getting better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The visit proved hugely expensive and a massive disappointment. Couldn't wait to get out of there!
reviews.title: Awful hotel - smells stale

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel two nights, on our first night in Europe and then on our last night. The first night we stayed there, the room that we got was horrible. The room looked dirty, the furniture was outdated, and the bathroom was very small. The coffee maker was disgusting. We asked for another room, but the receptionist said that there were none available at the time b/c we got there before check out (8am).
reviews.title: Still the best hotel in Heathrow

reviews.text: My adult daughter and I stayed for one night preparatory to a flight to Paris from Heathrow. While some of the reviews were less than stellar, the location and price were right. We were quite satisfied with our stay for several reasons. First, parking of our rental car was convenient, check in was quick and courteous, and best of all, the room was comfy, clean, and quiet. The bath was well stocked and equipped, and the beds cozy. Didn't hear a plane all night! We also repaired to the cocktail lounge and found it pleasant, with very good ambiance, service and drinks. Breakfast was also good and well priced, and check out easy. From there, it was a quick stop to return the rental car and take a shuttle to the airport. What I feared would be a drag proved to be a pleasant stay. I do recommend this hotel for travelers who need to catch some zzz's before further travel from Heathrow. We didn't use spa, room service, or pool.
reviews.title: Quiet and convenient; we were very comfortable.

reviews.text: Very handy for T5 (if you can easily handle your luggage, catch the free LT bus 350 opposite the hotel - it takes 7-10 minutes only compared with 30-40 mins on the Hoppa bus; first stop when returning from the airport).
reviews.title: Value for stay/park packages and handy for Terminal 5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is okay and when combined with a car parking offer during your absence, it represents reasonable value for money. Parked cars are left on-site in the car park.
reviews.title: Fine for overnight stay before the airport

reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable but extras, such as meals, are costly - opposite is a McDonalds and within 5 minutes walk, turning left on the main road, there is a choice of Chinese or Indian restaurants (I recommend the Kaniz if you like Indian cuisine).
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and very convenient to Heathrow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff were helpful and pleasant but the desk was undermanned and it took some time to check-in. I would, however, be happy to stay here again if using T5.
reviews.title: GREAT IF YOU LIKE SEMEN EVERYWHERE- Absolutely Disgusting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner took me to London and Paris for my 50th birthday, and we stayed at this hotel for the time we were in London. He got an awesome price, and the hotel itself looked nice, but the service was entirely lacking, and they nickel and dime you to death.
reviews.title: Great price on Hotwire, but not as good a deal as you might think

reviews.text: The first thing I noticed, just as we were checking in, was that there was no free WiFi in the Lobby. Even after our stay, I'm still not sure if there even IS WiFi in the Lobby. To have WiFi in the room, you must pay 15 pounds a day--and that's for one device. If you have an iPod Touch and a Laptop, you have to pay for both.
reviews.title: OK but not really up to usual Sheraton standards

reviews.text: Another problem was that during the entire time we stayed at this hotel, we never received washcloths--unless I went to the front desk to get them. I even asked if it was a cultural thing not to supply washcloths in British hotel rooms. Apparently our maid was just saving a little energy.
reviews.title: Poorly taken care of, slow staff and bad service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Speaking of the maid saving energy, one day the cleaning staff failed to freshen our room at all. When we arrived after a long day of touring, we cam back to an unkempt room!
reviews.title: Very convenient

reviews.text: In addition, we thought we were being thrifty travelers by staying that far out of London, and trust me, it is FAR out of London. We thought we could just take the Hotel Hoppa to and from the airport Tube station everyday. You can do that, but the Hotel Hoppa costs about 5 pounds per person per way, and if you arrive back to the airport late at night, you're likely to miss the Hoppa and have to take a cab. (The city buses only get you about a half a mile or so away--and that can be a haul with luggage!)
reviews.title: I won't be back in there

reviews.text: Well, what can you say? This is a very typical airport hotel. Decent lobby,OK food, unimaginative but functional rooms.
reviews.title: Typical

reviews.text: All in all, it does what it's meant to do, but nothing more. The "Hoppa" bus, at four pounds to and from Heathrow, proved to run frequently and reliably.
reviews.title: So-so cheer-for-nothing

likes.disliked: — Internet connection sucked, food sucks, location sucks

reviews.text: If you actually want to visit London, I would definitly reccomend staying closer, since it is a good hour to and from the hotel to anything worth seeing. To me, the savings are not worth the inconvenience.
reviews.title: Nice overall
Depends which room you get
reviews.text: I stayed a couple of nights already.The hotel is average overall. I guess, I'm lucky that I got one of those rooms , ground floor , behind reception. I arrived early Saturday morning and they accomodated me before check-in time which was very nice , something you would expect if you are coming from North America , why shouldn't they ?

The food at the restaurant was below average, had lunch first day and never been back. Staff was average overall, they had one concierge that was really helpful and kind, his name is Muhammad. Others were average ( you would call that rude in north America ). The hotel is in the middle of nowhere, meaning no shops/resto/business within walking distance, except for a McDonald, next door :-)
reviews.title: Quiet and very comfortable

reviews.text: I stopped over at the Sheraton Heathrow for a one-night stay on my way back to the U.S. The room seemed pleasant enough and was decorated well. There was Internet service available in the room, which would have been convenient if I were staying longer. I had only a few hours to sleep before getting up for an early morning flight, and I was hoping to get some much needed rest. Although the bed had soft pillows and an attractive quilt, the mattress was hard as a rock. It made it impossible to get any sleep and resulted in one of the worst nights in a hotel I have ever had.
reviews.title: Like Sleeping on a Park Bench

reviews.text: The hotel restaurant was the only choice for dinner, since there didn't seem to be any other restaurants in the area. I found the menu
reviews.title: Is this really a Sheraton?

likes.liked: — Proximity to Heathrow and friends in Windsor

reviews.text: to be quite limited and the prices were exhorbitant. It would have been 27GBP (over $50 US) for the buffet, so I opted for a plate of spaghetti that still cost over $20.
reviews.title: Purgatory right outside Heathrow

reviews.text: Front desk personnel were efficient and fairly friendly, and I do like Sheraton, but I would have to choose a different hotel next time, if only to get a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Not bad at all for an airport hotel

likes.disliked: — Expensive food and donation to charity.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights mid July for the first and only time.
reviews.title: A Typical Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Check-in was fast and efficient, rooms were adequate in size except carpeting seems rather dated in corridors/rooms and cheapens the hotel's appearance. Staff in the restaurant in the evening seem disorganised and in need of a little training...breakfast staff better. Free wifi in lobby but you have to pay for access in room. Car park 9.00gbp per night and you can come and go as you please...no ticketing necessary to go in or out once it is posted on your bill. There is a Dollar/Thrifty car rental on site. There are more modern hotels in the area but you pay the price accordingly...and to be honest there is nothing wrong with this hotel if you get it at a good price.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: My comments will echo other reviewers. Very convenient for airport via Hoppa H4 & H52.
reviews.title: Lobby / restaurant facelift but rooms long overdue

reviews.text: Lobby and restaurant renovation is good and raised my hopes the rooms had improved and didn't smell musty. Unfortunately the rooms haven't been updated and need to be.
reviews.title: Acceptable airport hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was not a very broad selection and I found hair on my cheese. Other than that it was 'functional'.
reviews.title: An ok travelers hotel

reviews.text: I've been Starwood plat for many years, now lifetime gold - a huge Starwood fan...but this hotel lets the Starwood brand down.
reviews.title: Great staff, smelly place

reviews.text: This hotel is on the edge of the airport yet the rooms are very quiet. Good facilities including a great gym and everything you need in the room, staff are friendly and efficient. The only downside was the cost of the Journey from the airport by bus or taxi, rip off but not the hotels fault. Couldn't fault the hotel, especially for the price.
reviews.title: Great value in perfect location

reviews.text: I stayed here a few weeks ago waiting for a flight out of LHR.
reviews.title: Okay in a pinch... but not fancy.

reviews.text: The hotel itself has a dorm-type layout with lots of hallways with lots of rooms. The lobby was decent but nothing to write home about. It's a clean place with a nice desk staff.
reviews.title: Good hotel, excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay at this hotel both coming and going from the UK to India. I was pleased that the reviews I read were very accurate. Good bed. Staff were excellent to the point of finding a maintenance man to fix my glasses. The lense had popped out after my flight and I had forgotten my little screwdriver. Thank goodness I travel with a second pair of glasses.
reviews.title: Ok, so it was only for one night

reviews.text: I used the Hoppa Bus service to get back and forth to Heathrow. Very convenient. I would stay there again and would recommend it highly.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.text: I have had the misfortune of staying here tonight, booked it as I was returning a car to thrifty car rental and had to be at london heathrow airport at 6am the following morning. No free internet stg15 per day, car parking stg 7.50 per night breakfast extra as well and they want stg 139 per night plus vat..... rip off merchants. No bathrobe, no slippers, freezing cold bedroom, sorry rabbit hutch, dark and gloomy even with all the lights on. Internet free in the lobby not in the rooms, open to the elements as door never closed. Receptionist unable to help in respect of booking and duty manager quite frankly did not give a monkeys, pay up or **** off attitude, said she would investigate and 4 hours later heard nothing from her and do not expect to either. If you have a choice stay at the premier inn or the hilton hotel down the road. Bus fare to the airport Stg4 on top of everything else. Room service stops at 11pm, breakfast starts at 6am what happens if like me you have to check in at the airport by 6am...... walk across the road to the bp garage and buy a sandwich that's what....
reviews.title: NEVER STAY HERE......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good size rooms, quick and efficient check in and out process. Cost appox 12 pounds for taxi to Heathrow terminals Or there is a hotel hoppa bus which also costs. Our room was quiet and though older was clean.
reviews.title: Convenient to Heathrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Heathrow on the 13th June before flying out on our honeymoon. We paid for a nights stay and 19 days car parking but when we arrived we could not park in proper space which concerened us as we were not coming back for nearly 3 weeks. I complained to the hotel reception but was told to park anywhere aslong as I did not obstruct fire escapes. We do not feel this is acceptable when have paid to ensure your car is safe.
reviews.title: Terrible start to our honeymoon

reviews.text: I was so concerened I had a family member come to collect my car and take it home for me.
reviews.title: Definitely Getting Better

reviews.text: Despite some less than favorable previous reviews, this Sheraton has been making improvements. I stayed a week for the Royal Wedding and had no problems or issues. The hallways did not reveal peeling paint, and the room was comfortable. I enjoyed the pillow top mattress the best. From the hotel it is about an hour journey using the bus/tube into central London. There are no major stores or restaurants nearby except the golden arches of McDonalds across the street. In the future I would recommend this hotel for a day layover at Heathrow. It is quiet with no fly over noise. They provide 45 free internet in the lobby daily, but it is expensive for in room internet access.
reviews.title: Efficient and Practical

reviews.text: Room itself was spotless, with comfortable bed and good linen. Air conditioning worked fine.
reviews.title: Room OK, but corridors need refurb

likes.liked: — Decent room easy to find from M4

reviews.text: Service at the bar was slow, and prices as high as you would expect from a Heathrow hotel
reviews.title: In need of a renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Corridors on second floor in real need of a make over, with walls and woodwork worn and damaged from, seemingly years of, bumps from heavy luggage.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How you judge this hotel depends on why you go there and how much you pay. I got a good price, (£99), for one night stay and 15 days parking from APH and thought the hotel was great for what I wanted. However, if I was looking for a luxury hotel, paying the kind of prices advertised at the reception I would look elsewhere.
reviews.title: hotel needs attention

likes.liked: — able a get a good night`s rest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Taxi to terminal 1 was £10.
reviews.title: To far to shabby

reviews.text: This is a great airport hotel. The staff was excellent. I would recommend reserving a Club Room. This includes free internet in your room, breakfast, both hot and cold, and evening wine/beer and finger food. There is a free bus (#350) that will take you back and forth to terminal #5. You can access terminals 1 and 3 by taking the Airport Express for free from Terminal #5.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there two weeks ago for one night. We requested a quiet room and were perfectly happy with it. It was in a quiet bit, everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. I loved the gym, it was very well equipped! The view was not great but I don't imagine it is easy to find a room with a good view at London Heathrow!
reviews.title: Comfortable room for the night, very good gym

reviews.text: I had a two night stay for business. I flew in from Valencia to T1 and took the (free) local bus U3/75/76 from the Central Bus Station to the bus stop on Bath Road. The hotel is an easy five minute walk from there. Check in was quick and friendly, Gosia (sp?) explained the property (in English and a bit of Spanish) to me while checking me into my 3rd floor club room. The room was clean and filled with all your amenities expected at a SPG property. Snacks in the Club Room were great, and the staff working that evening were stellar in hospitality and making sure I had a drink in hand. Internet in room was relatively fast, I had my laptop and phone connected. The second day all my amenities were replenished. Checkout was done in 15 seconds, and I received an email with my receipt within an hour of leaving. Overall a good option for an airport hotel and I will be staying there when I have to return to London next month, maybe even with my wife and daughter.
reviews.title: Nice Airport Hotel with GREAT staff

reviews.text: Firstly I know airport hotels are normally for one or two nights but I am getting tired or how tired they all seem to be. With the exception of the newer premier inns the hotels around Heathrow are past their sell by date.
reviews.title: Another tired and lacking airport hotel

reviews.text: Good points was a cheap deal for a Club Lounge room for one night. Free Internet big plus, plus the lounge for free tea and coffee with light snacks. The lounge feels small, but adequate for one night stays. Reception staff great, even the restaurant staff were good despite the later incident.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and convenient room for a perfect stopover at Heathrow, London.

reviews.text: Just a one night stay waiting for a connecting flight and I found this hotel clean, fresh and quite inexpensive. They served a buffet breakfast which was free for my group and quite delicious and the Hoppa shuttle was just outside the front door costing 4.5 pounds to get you to terminal 4 or 5. The rooms are clean and have all the required amenities. Staff are friendly and very helpful. When the Hoppa was late they immediately contacted the right persons to get the bus to us.
reviews.title: Inexpensive quality hotel near Heathrow

reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel for any required stays near Heathrow.
reviews.title: Thank Goodness it was only One Night

reviews.text: Oh sheraton, how you disappoint me.
reviews.title: Everything You Need...Close to the Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know I shouldn't be too critical since its only an airport hotel, but I was disappointed in the service you provided me.
reviews.title: good value airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First I arrived around 11pm and it took more than ten minutes to check in. I was glad to hear of my upgrade to executive level, but when I got to room I felt truly sorry for those not upgraded because my room was a little bit bigger than a coat room. I was also giving free Wi-Fi, but I had trouble accessing it and it took three phone calls and more than a dozen rings before I finally go the assistance of guest services.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not often that I was turned off by staff as soon as I walk in the door. I checked in and the felt very overlooked and not important. The person checking me in pretty much dismissed me as the transaction was being processed. Internet is extremely expensive, but you are granted a 45 minute ration in the front lobby. Not very private. The hallways are dark and dingy. The room, the same. This is a hotel airport and they know it.
reviews.title: First impressions...

reviews.text: You can use the Hoppa Bus, but its 4 pounds per person and it is such a short ride. In Terminal 5 get the 350 or 432. It's Free! It will leave you about a 11/2 blocks away.
reviews.title: Nothing free at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terminal 1,2,3 you can get the U3, 75 or 76. It is really the only reason the hotel didn't get a 1 star... There is a McDonald's across the street because the quoted prices for breakfast was extremely expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: It's too bad, I expected more from Sheraton.
reviews.title: Would not stay here again

reviews.text: Very expensive internet access in room. No free hotel airpiort shuttle (must pay for it). Expensive mini-bar in room (one soda was about $US 5. T.v. is ok, although the old boxy CRV trype (not flat screen)..needs upgrading. You can control the air and heater in the room (at least it's free). Food was average. Carpeting needs replacing and room smelled very musty. The hotel could use a complete make-over.
reviews.title: Loved the place

description: Sheraton Heathrow Hotel is located less than a mile from Heathrow Terminal 5 and is only minutes away from any of the terminals. The Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed, The Link at Sheraton, Sheraton Club and Sheraton Fitness powered by Core Performance make it a comfortable choice where guests find a home away from home. A welcoming team of talent always strives to make guests feel special and to create a warm sense of community to be enjoyed by all.
